page.title: 10A FARMER'S DAY IN HAMSTERLEY
page.content: The work of a farmer varies from season to season,the busiest being February to April when the calves and lambs are born,usually between 5.00 and 7.00 a.m.At this time I start work at 6.00 instead of the usual 8.00.a.m. My days throughout the year are filled from early morning to lunch checking the sheep,feeding the hens and stock and cleaning the byres.After lunch I do odd jobs such as manure spreading,fencing and machine maintenance.I once again check the sheep and stock before tea.About 6.00 I make a final check of stock,feed and bed up for the night. In the evenings I watch T.V. with my family,occasionally attend social gatherings and dances in the Village Hall or do home maintenace.I live in a modernised farmhouse,3 miles from the village with my wife and 2 children.
